definitions.definition: The act of binding oneself by a social, legal, or moral tie to someone.
A social, legal, or moral requirement, duty, contract, or promise that compels someone to follow or avoid a particular course of action.
A course of action imposed by society, law, or conscience by which someone is bound or restricted.
A legal agreement stipulating a specified action or forbearance by a party to the agreement; the document containing such agreement.
definitions.example: X shall be entitled to subcontract its obligation to provide the Support Services. <>
